title: Building, Dwelling, Thinking

The real meaning of the verb bauen, namely, to dwell, has been lost to us. But a covert trace has been preserved in the German word Nachbar, neighbor. The neighbor is in Old English the neahgebur; neah, near, and gebur, dweller. The Nachbar is the Nachbebur, the Nachgebauer, the near-dweller, he who dwells nearby
